title: Jandy VersaTemp Heat Pump — Guided Troubleshooting

s1.text: Is the control board display ON?

no_display.text: Breaker/fuse may be tripped, or phase loss/reversal (3-phase models).

s2.text: Is the display showing FAULT – NO FLOW?

fault_no_flow.text: Verify circulating pump is ON, valves open, filters/skimmers clean, and water level is adequate.

s3.text: Is the display showing FAULT – HIGH REF PRESSURE?

fault_high_ref.text: Check pump/valves/filters for restrictions. Switch to higher pump speed if variable-speed. Cycle power up to 3 times. Call for service if persists.

s4.text: Is the display showing FAULT – LOW REF PRESSURE?

fault_low_ref.text: Check fan operation (air blowing out top). May be normal if water < 50°F. Call for service if persists.

s5.text: Is the display showing FAULT – HIGH WATER TEMP?

fault_high_water.text: Pool/spa water reached max allowed temp. Normal unless caused by bad sensor or remote call. Check sensors, cool water, or switch to CHILLER mode.

s6.text: Is the display showing FAULT – COIL SENSOR?

fault_coil.text: Coil temperature sensor not connected or failed. Replace if necessary.

s7.text: Is the display showing FAULT – WATER SENSOR?

fault_water_sensor.text: Water temperature sensor not connected or failed. Replace if necessary.

s8.text: Is the heat pump leaking water?

leak_check.text: Turn off pump for 1 hour. If water stops → normal condensation. If leak continues → call for service.
